content.question: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by Pitt’s description of France’s goals with regard to Great Britain?

choices.label: France wished to imitate the British system of parliamentary monarchy.
France wished to export its radical revolutionary ideas to Great Britain.
France found no British subjects receptive to revolutionary ideas.
France focused on continental rivals and had no hostile intentions toward Great Britain.

content.answer: France wished to export its radical revolutionary ideas to Great Britain.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
